metadata.title: CVE-2021-39648 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In gadget_dev_desc_UDC_show of configfs.c, there is a possible disclosureof kernel heap memory due to a race condition. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with System execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-160822094References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39648` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-4.15.0-137-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-generic - 4.15.0-137.141
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-137-lowlatency - 4.15.0-137.141
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-137.141').
